page.title: 15CEMETERY - NEWS REPORTS
page.content: {September 1980}Residents of houses overlooking an unused part of the Cemetery complained about an area adjacent to their gardens being used as a tipping ground. "No Tipping" signs were then erected. {October 1980}A local newspaper article reported that vandalism had resulted in Â£10,000 of damage being caused. Some gravestones over 100 years old would cost over Â£100 each to repair. {June 1983}Emergency drainage pumps had been brought into the Cemetery to prepare the ground for the funeral of a local Falklands hero killed at Goose Green. {October 1984}A letter appeared in a local newspaper complaining about the cost of grave headstones which had to be supplied by Stockport Council's own mason.
